Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameLogic
  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the main logic part of the game, as it processes.

    • Constructor Summary

      The default constructor for the GameLogic class, this initialises both the global variables and objects with values

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic()
        The default constructor for the GameLogic class, this initialises both the global variables and objects with values

    • Method Detail

      • getTileValue

        public java.lang.String getTileValue​(int xPos,
                                     int yPos)
        A method that finds the character (tile) at a specific position in the map by indexing array lists. If exception occurs as index is outside bounds of the array, a wall tile is returned.
        Parameters:
        xPos - integer - the integer value of the 'column' that needs to be indexed
        yPos - integer - the integer value of the 'row' that needs to be indexed
        Returns:
        tile char - the char value at the specified position on the map

      • gameRunning

        public boolean gameRunning()
        A method that checks if the game should still be running. Checks if the bot has captured the player by comparing x and y co-ordinates of both. Checks if the player has enter 'quit' while on top of an Exit tile.
        Returns:
        if the game is running.

      • hello

        protected java.lang.String hello()
        A method that handles the input of the 'hello' command by the user. Returns the amount of gold the user must collect on this map to win the game.
        Returns:
        goldRequired int - An integer storing the amount of gold required to be collected by the player in order for them to win the game. Concatenates prefix string with integer parsed to a string.

      • gold

        protected java.lang.String gold()
        A method that handles the input of the 'gold' command by the user. Returns the amount of gold the user has collected up to that point in the game. Concatenates prefix string with integer parsed to a string.
        Returns:
        goldOwned int - An integer storing the amount of gold the user has collected so far.

      • move

        protected java.lang.String move​(char direction)
        A method that handles the input of the 'move x' command by the user, where x is a compass direction. Checks whether the move is legal (is not a movement into a wall), returns the result of this validity test and, if the move is legal, updates the player's location on the map. Assumes move is illegal by default, calls getTileValue method to retrieve the tile at the location the player wishes to move to.
        Parameters:
        direction - char - A single alphabetic character representing the user's desired direction of movement e.g. 'n' is North, 'e' is East etc.
        Returns:
        result String - The result of whether the move was legal or not and therefore whether the player's location was able to be updated or not.

      • look

        protected java.lang.String look()
        A method that handles the input of the 'look' command by the player. Cycles through the tiles with a 2 tile range on all sides of the player to produce 25 tiles including the player's location in the centre. The tiles are added in rows to a string where each row is appended with a '\n' representing a new line. If the tile being looked at is the bot's location, a 'B' will be added in place of the map tile.
        Returns:
        mapAsString String - A string containing 25 characters as well as 5 new line symbols focusing around the player at the middle.

      • pickup

        protected java.lang.String pickup()
        A method that handles the input of the 'pickup' command by the user. Processes the player's pickup command, checks if the player is currently at a tile with a gold, updating the map to replace the 'G' tile with an empty tile and increments the player's gold amount.
        Returns:
        result boolean - The result of whether or not the player was able to pick up a gold in their current location.

      • quitGame

        protected java.lang.String quitGame()
        A method that handles the input of the 'quit' command by the user. Checks if the command is legal by checking if the play is at a location with an 'E' tile. If not denies the user command, otherwise, checks if the player has collected the same amount fo gold as is required.
        Returns:
        result String - The result of the player's command, whether it be a win, a loss or an invalid move.

      • placePlayer

        public java.awt.Point placePlayer()
        A method that handles the placing of both the human player and the user on the map at the beginning of the game. Assumes that a valid position has not been found yet. Runs a loop that , while the position found is not valid, will generate a pair of random numbers within the range of the dimensions of the chosen map. This potential position is then compared against the map to ensure it is not either a wall or a gold tile or is already the player's position as otherwise this might mean that the bot is placed in the same place as the player and the game is already lost. The potential position does not need to be compared against the bot's position as the player is placed on the map already.
        Returns:
        potentialPosition Point - returns a point variable that holds the valid x and y co ordinates of the position to be assigned to either the bot or the human player.

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
        A method that handles the main game running loop. Calls methods to get the user's choice of map and then read the map into the map arraylist, place the player and the bot on the map before running the main game loop while the game running conditions are true. This loop handles both the player's and the bot's moves in sequence.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method that runs by default when the program starts. Creates a new creates a new instance of the GameLogic class. Once this has been created and the constructor has been run the runGame method is called from here the rest of the program is run and the main game running loop begins.
        Parameters:
        args - String[] - A default string array parameter that must be passed for the program to run.
